KnowledgeBase.Title: isObject
KnowledgeBase.ArgumentTypes: Character String Symbol Vector BitVector ByteVector IntVector FltVector ObjVector Structure Dictionary Directory Brick Pair List Matrix NumMatrix Integer Float Number Complex Boolean ShortVector
KnowledgeBase.DataType: String Symbol Structure Dictionary Directory Vector NumMatrix Pair List Brick Matrix ShortVector FltVector IntVector NumVector ObjVector BitVector PcodeVector ByteVector
KnowledgeBase.RelatedFunctions: isType isString isText isSymbol isBitVector isPcodeVector isVector isPair isByteVector isNumberVector isFloatVector isIntegerVector isNumberMatrix isStructure isDictionary isDirectory isObjectVector

Function.Description: The isObject function returns true is the argument is an Analytic Information Server Object. Otherwise, it returns false.

Brief.Overview: The isObject Function returns true if the argument {obj} is an Object; otherwise, false is returned.
Brief.Usage: The isObject function is used to query a variable or constant to determine if it is an Analytic Information Server object data type. The isObject function will return true if the object is one of the following: Symbol (Unquoted or Quoted), List, Pair (Unquoted or Quoted), Vector (BitVector, IntVector, FloatVector, NumVector, SmallVector, ObjVector, PcodeVector), Matrix (BitMatrix, IntMatrix, FloatMatrix, NumMatrix, SmallMatrix, ObjMatrix, PcodeMatrix), Structure, Dictionary, Directory, Repository, Brick, Lambda.

Argument.Name: obj
Argument.AISTypes:
Character, String, Symbol, Vector, BitVector, ByteVector, IntVector, ShortVector FltVector, ObjVector, Structure, Dictionary, Directory, Pair, List
Matrix, NumMatrix, Integer, Float, Number, Complex, Brick

Syntax.Return: Boolean value true if the object is an Object, otherwise false is returned.
